name: Chariot
description: Embark on a journey to give his majesty the ride of his afterlife. Guide a chariot containing the King's remains through underground caves using physics-based mechanics such as pushing, pulling, riding and swinging.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: Dual Core 2.5 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 4850 / NVIDIA GeForce GTX 260 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 3 GB available space Additional Notes: Notice: We highly recommend playing Chariot with a controller.

reviews.review_text: Recommended to play with controller and your fiance/fiancee for a load of epic high fives.

My wife and I had an absolutely wonderful time with this game. I can't overstate that enough. Playing co-op and using controllers is definitely the ideal way to play this game, if you can do that I would recommend this game to literally everyone.

I would reccomend this game to anybody that enjoys spending unknown amounts of time exploring and collecting jewels :P The king is alongside you in the chariot, upset that you have tried to bury him in a final resting spot that does not please him. You are on a quest to gather riches, and to find a suitable final resting place for the king. Beautiful graphics also make this game a high reccomendation :) You can also grab a player 2 to join you and help you gather more precious jewels *I have yet to know how I can rate 2 player games* But I bet it would be great! Excellent game :)   CONTROLLER HIGHLY RECCOMENDED!!! :)
Don't listen to anyone who says that this game is short I have been playing it collecting all the things and have been playing for 15 hours and I am only 51% complete

I bought this game during the steam sale just because it looked kinda interesting. It turned out to be really fun to play and had the right amount of challenge (and yelling at your co-op partner when doing the optional tricky treasure hunts). I've only played co-op and I didn't finish the whole game yet so I can't answer for singleplayer, but the gameplay is pretty straightforward. It's a physics puzzle game built around pulling a cart with a rope or two. You can unlock stuff inbetween stages when you find the parts for it in the levels and collect enough treasure. The levels are quite big and the artstyle is cute. Not sure how long the game is but we did everything we could find in each level so far and I think it took about 40 minutes or more per stage. I'm happy I bought it in any case!
Fun little co-op game with lots to collect.

Not a terrible game but not one I enjoyed playing. The levels are huge and mostly boring to complete. I didn't understand how certain things work in the game. There are hints flashed on the screen while a level is loading, I can't read a complete sentence in one second, how about leaving them on the screen a bit longer.   I'm sure I could have figured out all the rules of the game, but gameplay is so mediocre I didn't feel motivated to do so.

I really like the game and enjoy the co-op concept. BE WARNED it is local co-op only and that pretty much makes it unplayable for me. YOu can play single player but it is obviously geared toward the cooperative gameplay. Make it online co-op and you have my solid recomendation
Beautiful and cute graphics, nice gameplay that's challenging when trying to play solo and engaging when playing with a friend, and definitely a great game all around. I definitely recommend.

This game gets boring after awhile and solo is not fun at all, but I couldn't give this game a bad review because I put more hours that I spent. Also, its not to bad. When you first play especially with a friend, the game is very fun. Its very long too, but will give you many hours even though it gets boring pulling that cart around after awhile.

Check out dj. his review. It sums the game up pretty good. Nothing to add there, except Philips Ambilight support. It found my Hue Bridge instantly and works nicely. Gives a nice touch to a great game. A hidden gem!
